OptimalBinningWoE 0.0.0.9000

Optimal Binning Data Preprocessor Interface

OptimalBinningDataPreprocessorInterface.Rd

This function serves as an interface to the Rcpp function OptimalBinningDataPreprocessor. It preprocesses the data for optimal binning by handling missing values, outliers, and other preprocessing steps.

Usage

OptimalBinningDataPreprocessorInterface(
  target,
  feature,
  num_miss_value = -999,
  char_miss_value = "N/A",
  outlier_method = "grubbs",
  outlier_process = TRUE,
  preprocess = as.character(c("both")),
  iqr_k = 1.5,
  zscore_threshold = 3,
  grubbs_alpha = 0.05
)

Arguments

target

A numeric binary vector (0 and 1) representing the target variable.

feature

A numeric or character vector representing the feature to be preprocessed.

num_miss_value

A numeric value representing the missing value for numeric features. Default is -999.

char_miss_value

A character value representing the missing value for character features. Default is "N/A".

outlier_method

A character string specifying the method for outlier detection. Default is "grubbs".

outlier_process

A logical value indicating whether to process outliers. Default is TRUE.

preprocess

A character vector specifying the preprocessing steps to be performed. Default is "both".

iqr_k

A numeric value specifying the interquartile range multiplier for outlier detection. Default is 1.5.

zscore_threshold

A numeric value specifying the z-score threshold for outlier detection. Default is 3.

grubbs_alpha

A numeric value specifying the significance level for Grubbs' test. Default is 0.05.

Value

A data.table containing the preprocessed data.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example usage
target <- c(0, 1, 0, 1, 0)
feature <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
result <- OptimalBinningDataPreprocessorInterface(target, feature)
print(result)
} # }
